titlestmt.titleproper: Gardner, Mass. First Congregational Church records, 1786-2023. RG5486
titlestmt.author: Billy McCarthy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-11-15 16:55:18 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Gardner, Mass. First Congregational Church records, 1786-2023.
did.abstract: In February 1786, thirty-three members would form the First Congregational Church of Gardner, led by town physician Rev. Jonathan Osgood. In 1830, there was a split in the congregation which resulted in a separate, Evangelical Church. They would form together again in 1846, adopting the creed of the Evangelical Church. In the 1880s, the church started to take part in the Christian Endeavor movement and the Young Ladies' Missionary Society began teaching English to the rising population of non-English speakers in Gardner. In the 1950s, Rev. Daniel Leavitt would arrive and breathe new life into the church, including modernizing the Parish House and renovating many of its features. The church would make the decision to close for good in 2023. This collection contains various records related to the entire history of the First Congregational Church. This includes meeting minutes, annual reports, auxiliary groups, vital statistics, photographs, scrapbooks, and building records.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
userestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Gardner, Mass. First Congregational Church records, 1786-2023, RG5486. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational & Library and Archives by the First Congregational Church in October 2023, 2023-52.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Billy McCarthy, November 2024, using Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The town of Gardner, Mass, was incorporated in June of 1785 and four months later at the third town meeting, talks began to start building a meeting-house. In February of 1786, thirty-three members would form the First Congregational Church of Gardner. The first meeting-house would be raised on June 27, 1787. The first minister, who also happened to be the first physician of Gardner, was Dr. Jonathan Osgood. Dr. Osgood would remain a central part of the church and the town of Gardner until his death in 1822.

Starting around 1830, a divide started to form that would be common in many other areas of the country. More liberal minded members would begin to call themselves Unitarian while the more conservative called themselves Orthodox. The orthodox members, alongside the current minister Rev. Increase Summer Lincoln, would form the Evangelical Congregational Church. Both groups did agree to share many items needed for worship and equally divided what money was on hand at the time.

First Congregational Church would see increased membership over the next decade and in 1846, the church would reunite with the Evangelical Congregational Church. They kept the First Congregational Church name, the creed of the Evangelical Church, and worshipped in the Evangelical Church's building. A parsonage was built in 1875 and a brand-new church was dedicated in 1879. In the 1880s the church started to take part in the Christian Endeavor movement and the Young Ladies' Missionary Society began teaching English to the rising population of non-English speakers in Gardner.

Rev. Burton S. Gilman would serve as the pastor from 1897-1920 and was known as an eloquent and convincing speaker, loved amongst the community. After a series of short-lived pastorates, Rev. Baldwin W. Callahan would lead the church up through 1949. Under his pastorate, the Evening Guild, Men's Club, and Married Couples' Group would form, and the Woman's Association would form out of two previously separate groups. In the 1950s, Rev. Daniel Leavitt would arrive and breathe new life into the church, including modernizing the Parish House and renovating many of its features.

The church would continue to engage in its works and mission and led by ministers such as Rev John Condor, Rev. Edgar Kemp, Jr., Rev. Frank McKenzie and more. The church would make the decision to close for good in 2023. At its final service on October 1st, they were led by transitional minister Rev. Stacey Kullgren. The history of the First Congregational Church is entwined with the history of Gardner and its impact will always be felt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various records related to the entire history of the First Congregational Church. This includes meeting minutes, annual reports, auxiliary groups, vital statistics, photographs, scrapbooks, and building records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into the six series and seven subseries as listed below. Within each series and subseries, materials have been arranged in chronological order. When appropriate, some material is arranged by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains information related to church records and includes meeting minutes, reports, historical information, events, and newsletters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meeting minutes are reports related to core operations of the First Congregational Church. These include annual reports, church meeting minutes, treasurer's reports, church correspondences, board of Trustees meeting minutes, church council meeting minutes, and more.

did.unittitle: Special committee to address church concerns
Board of Trustees meeting minutes (1 of 2)
Board of Trustees meeting minutes (2 of 2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains newsletters produced by the First Congregational Church, including the Gardner journal, the Tower Times, and Tidings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to events and the history of the First Congregational Church, including constitution and bylaws, a church times, and records related to church anniversaries.

did.unittitle: Survey on the history of Gardner

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the many ministers of First Congregational Church and includes correspondences, sermons, call agreements, and information on the final service of the church.

did.unittitle: Biography of Rev. Burton Smith Gilman
A sermon on hope by Rev. Burton Smith Gilman
God's gift and out response - a sermon in five parts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various records related to various auxiliary groups from the First Congregational Church, including educational groups, Women's groups, the Massachusetts Conference, and from the Diaconate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to various Women's groups part of the First Congregational Church, including the Ladies' social circle, Ladies' sewing society, Women's fellowship, Women's missionary society, Women's missionary society and Women's Association.

did.unittitle: Ladies' social and benevolent circle treasurer's reports
Auxiliary Women Board of Missions finances
Home Department of the Women's Missionary Society reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the various educational groups of the First Congregational Church, including the Christian Endeavor meeting minutes, Bible study, Sunday School, Christian education society, Fellowship committee, and more.

did.unittitle: Grace A. Howe sacred concert series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records relating to interactions between the Massachusetts Conference and the First Congregational Church, including meeting minutes, yearbook applications, and annual reports

did.unittitle: Massachusetts Congregational Conference at First Congregational Church
Central Association of Massachusetts Conference records (1 of 2)
Central Association of Massachusetts Conference records (2 of 2)
Central Association of Massachusetts Conference annual reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains meeting minutes and reports from both Deacons and Deaconesses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various vital statistics from the First Congregational Church and includes baptisms, deaths, marriages, membership, letters of dismission, and letters of transfer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains visual materials like photographs and scrapbooks.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook on church visit to Puerto Rico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the operation of the church building and includes renovation material, inventories, alterations, maintenance, and more.

did.unittitle: Alterations to the First Congregational Church
Preparations and guidelines for church events
